Formal.definition: relating to or involving outward form

1.definition: relating to or involving outward form, structure, or arrangement rather than content [a defect in the pleadings]

2.definition: requiring special or established solemnities or formalities esp. in order to be effective or valid under the law [received notice] [a criminal charge]

3.definition: being such only as a matter of form[a party to a lawsuit]
